page.title: 04COASTLINE AROUND LAMLASH.
page.content: Lamlash,as a frequented village by tourists inevitably has a large beach which attracts tourists for leisure and wildlife pursuits.At low tide the beach reaches a length of 2km. from North to South. There are two main rivers which carry deposits down to the beach.These can stain the beach a muddy brown colour especially after high rainfall due to them eroding large amounts of soil as they pass through the forestry and farming zones. Lamlash beach is mainly used as an area for mooring and recreational pursuits.Due to the sewage outflow it is not as popular an area for swimming as other beaches around the island.In some parts of the beach there are long Basalt dykes which are easily seen as long black strips of rock on the beach.
